CollectionCitations.Title: TSIS TIM Level 3 Total Solar Irradiance 24-Hour Means V03

Use the Earthdata Search to find and retrieve data sets across multiple data centers.

Abstract:
Version 03 is the current release of this data product, and supercedes all previous versions.

The TSIS TIM Level 3 Total Solar Irradiance (TSI) 24-Hour Means data product (TSIS_TSI_L3_24HR) uses measurements from the Total Irradiance Monitor (TIM) instrument over the entire spectrum, and averages them over a 24-hour period. TSIS-1 was launched on December 15, 2017 and mounted on the International Space Station (ISS) on December 30, 2017. TIM instrument has long-term repeatability with estimated uncertainties less than 0.014 W/m^2/yr (10 ppm/yr). Accuracy is currently reported as 0.48 W/m^2 (350 ppm), but expected to decrease as calibrations are refined and incorporated. Irradiances are reported at a mean solar distance of 1 AU and zero relative line-of-sight velocity with respect to the Sun.

All of the data from this product are arranged into a single file in a tabular ASCII text format which can be easily read into a spreadsheet application. New data are appended to the file on a daily basis. The columns contain the date, Julian day, minimum wavelength, maximum wavelength, instrument mode, data version number, irradiance value, irradiance uncertainty, and data quality. The rows are arranged with data at each wavelength over the full TIM wavelength range, repeating for each day for the length of the mission.
VersionDescription:
TSIS_TSI_L3_24HR Version 03 is the current version of this data product, and supersedes all previous versions. Please see the SORCE TIM Release Notes for detailed description and differences of this and previous versions.

Version 03 - released 15 Aug 2019 - doi:10.5067/TSIS/TIM/DATA306
Data availability: 2018/01/11 to current

Version 02 - released 15 Aug 2019 - doi:10.5067/TSIS/TIM/DATA304
Data availability: 2018/01/11 to 2020/05/22

Version 01 - released 19 Sep 2018 - doi:10.5067/TSIS/TIM/DATA302
Data availability: 2018/01/11 to 2019/08/13
